2OperationalChina North 3OperationalChina East 3OperationalQatar CentralOperationalMexico CentralOperationalScheduled MaintenanceGeneric Planned MaintenancePlanned MaintenanceScheduleJanuary 12, 2026 14:00 - 16:00 UTCComponentsAI/BI, Compute, Databricks SQL, Lakeflow, Notebooks, Unity CatalogLocationsAustralia Central 2DescriptionDatabricks is migrating the Hive Metastore (HMS) infrastructure to a new platform. As part of this migration, the HMS backend databases will move to servers with new IP addresses and subnets.

If you currently reference Hive Metastore IP addresses directly in user-defined routes or firewalls, you must update your configuration before the maintenance window. Failure to update these rules will result in Hive Metastore access failures and service outages (e.g., job failures, cluster start failures).

Maintenance Window

The migration will occur between 14:00 UTC and 16:00 UTC on January 12, 2025.
Each region will experience a brief service interruption of approximately 30 minutes during this window.

Action Required (must be completed prior to January 12, 2025)

If your environment uses hard-coded Hive Metastore IP addresses:

1. Recommended: 
Update your user-defined routes or firewall rules (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/databricks/security/network/classic/udr#azure-service-tags) to use the Azure SQL service tag instead of static HMS IP addresses. This ensures future IP changes do not cause outages. 

2. If your security policy does not allow service tags: 
Add the reserved IP ranges (https://community.databricks.com/t5/product-platform-updates/ip-cidr-for-azure-databricks-hive-metastore/ba-p/133401) for Hive Metastore to your routing or firewall rules. If supported, you may also allow the HMS FQDNs provided in the same documentation. 

Customers who already allow Azure service tags or FQDN-based rules do not need to take further action and will not experience disruption to running jobs.

These actions must be completed by January 12, 2025. If the maintenance is rescheduled, the same configuration changes will still be required prior to the revised window to prevent service disruption.Generic Planned MaintenancePlanned MaintenanceScheduleJanuary 13, 2026 01:00 - 03:00 UTCComponentsAI/BI, Compute, Databricks SQL, Lakeflow, Notebooks, Unity CatalogLocationsWest IndiaDescriptionDatabricks is migrating the Hive Metastore (HMS) infrastructure to a new platform. As part of this migration, the HMS backend databases will move to servers with new IP addresses and subnets.

If you currently reference Hive Metastore IP addresses directly in user-defined routes or firewalls, you must update your configuration before the maintenance window. Failure to update these rules will result in Hive Metastore access failures and service outages (e.g., job failures, cluster start failures).

Maintenance Window

The migration will occur between 01:00 UTC and 03:00 UTC on January 13, 2025.
Each region will experience a brief service interruption of approximately 30 minutes during this window.

Action Required (must be completed prior to January 13, 2025)

If your environment uses hard-coded Hive Metastore IP addresses:

1. Recommended: 
Update your user-defined routes or firewall rules (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/databricks/security/network/classic/udr#azure-service-tags) to use the Azure SQL service tag instead of static HMS IP addresses. This ensures future IP changes do not cause outages. 

2. If your security policy does not allow service tags: 
Add the reserved IP ranges (https://community.databricks.com/t5/product-platform-updates/ip-cidr-for-azure-databricks-hive-metastore/ba-p/133401) for Hive Metastore to your routing or firewall rules. If supported, you may also allow the HMS FQDNs provided in the same documentation. 

Customers who already allow Azure service tags or FQDN-based rules do not need to take further action and will not experience disruption to running jobs.

These actions must be completed by January 13, 2025. If the maintenance is rescheduled, the same configuration changes will still be required prior to the revised window to prevent service disruption.StatusHistorySubscribe to receive status updates by emailCloseSubscribeManage SubscriptionManage Existing SubscriptionCreate New SubscriptionSubscribe to receive status updates by webhookEach status update will POST a JSON payload to this URLEmail address for managing webhookCloseSubscribeManage SubscriptionManage Existing SubscriptionCreate New SubscriptionSubscribe to receive status updates in Microsoft TeamsEnter your Microsoft Teams webhook.View InstructionsEmail address for managing subscriptionCloseSubscribeManage SubscriptionManage Existing SubscriptionCreate New SubscriptionSubscribe to receive status updates in SlackSlack channel IDFind the channel ID:Select the channel in your Slack workspace. outage.RelatedNo incidents or maintenance related to this downtime.Past IncidentsJan12,2026No incidents reported today.Jan11,2026No incidents reported.Jan10,2026Pardot connectors failing with "IllegalArgumentException Unrecognized type LocalTime".Resolved-This incident has been resolved. We have observed that instance rates are returning to normal levels, and affected connections are syncing successfully.Incident SummaryDescription:We identified an issue with the Pardot connections, which resulted in syncs failing with a 'IllegalArgumentException Unrecognized type LocalTime' error.Timeline:This issue began on January 8th, at around 17:00 UTC and was resolved on January 10th, at around 1:20 UTC.Cause:The incident was triggered by the rollout of the ENGAGEMENT_STUDIO_PROGRAM table, on 2026-01-07, as a result of which we tried to write an incompatible data type, LocalTime, to the destination. Consequently, the connectors failed during flush operations due to this.Resolution:Service was restored by pausing the rollout of the feature. A permanent fix has been submitted to transition the data mapping from LocalTime to String. The rollout of the ENGAGEMENT_STUDIO_PROGRAM table will be resumed in the upcoming days.Jan10,14:15UTCMonitoring-A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.Jan10,14:00UTCUpdate-We have identified a data type mismatch affecting the Pardot connector. An incompatible LocalTime definition in the engagement_studio_program table introduced via a rollout on January 6 is currently unsupported by the BigQuery writer, leading to failure rate.We are working on a hotfix to address the IllegalArgumentException and resolve the issue.Jan10,10:28UTCIdentified-The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.Jan10,10:25UTCFivetran: Quickstart Transformations auto-enabled for existing ConnectionsResolved-A fix has been deployed to production to prevent transformations from being unintentionally created during connector setup tests. New connectors and edits will no longer trigger these transformations.Any previously created transformations that are still present and can be removed now. We are also working on a cleanup process to remove these jobs automatically where feasible.The incident is fully resolved and is no longer impacting customers. A detailed RCA will be shared within the next week.Jan10,01:21UTCMonitoring-A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.Jan9,22:55UTCIdentified-The issue has been identified and we are working to resolve it.Jan9,18:55UTCJan9,20263rd Party: Few Ringcentral connections are failing with the not found errorResolved-This incident has been resolved. We have engaged with RingCentral Support to investigate the underlying API issue on their side.Resolution:We handled the 404 exception by skipping this endpoint during syncs, allowing the remaining data to sync successfully.Jan9,13:28UTCMonitoring-A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.Jan9,12:24UTCIdentified-The issue has been identified and we are working to resolve it.Jan9,11:55UTCJan8,20263rd Party: Reddit Ads connections are experiencing failures due to API authentication and server errorsResolved-This incident has been resolved. We have observed that instance rates are returning to normal levels and affected connectors are syncing successfully.Incident SummaryDescription:We’ve identified that Reddit Ads connection syncs are experiencing failures due to API authentication and server errors.Timeline:This issue began on January 7th, 20:06 UTC and was resolved on January 8th, 9:20 UTC.Cause:The issue was caused by a third-party outage impacting the Reddit Ads Communities API. The API intermittently returned authentication and server-side errors, resulting in sync failures for affected Reddit Ads connections.Resolution:To mitigate the issue, we implemented a change to skip the problematic Reddit Ads Communities endpoint by placing UFL (User-Facing Limitation) information on the affected endpoint. In parallel, we have engaged Reddit Support to further investigate the underlying API issue on their side.Jan8,12:37UTCMonitoring-A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.Jan8,10:59UTCUpdate-We’ve identified that the failures are related to the Reddit Ads Communities API.
